spanishExample: ¿Cómo le va? ¿Va a querer esto?
englishTranslation: (formal) How is it going? Are you going to want this?
vocabIncluded: cómo le va: how's it going? (formal) (idiom)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: ¿Cómo les va? ¿Quieren ir ahora?
englishTranslation: (All of you) How is it going? Do you want to go now?
vocabIncluded: cómo les va: how's it going? (plural) (idiom)

spanishExample: ¿Cómo te va? ¡Te queremos tener en la fiesta!
englishTranslation: How is it going? We want to have you at the party!
vocabIncluded: cómo te va: how's it going? (idiom)

spanishExample: Al mismo tiempo, no tenemos dónde estar.
englishTranslation: At the same time, we don’t have a place to be.
vocabIncluded: al mismo tiempo: "at the same time" (idiom)

spanishExample: Él quiere lo mismo que yo quiero.
englishTranslation: He wants the same thing that I want.
vocabIncluded: "lo": "the" with no noun, as in "lo bueno"
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Ella ha querido hacer eso a esta hora.
englishTranslation: She has wanted to do that at this hour.
vocabIncluded: ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: En el pasado, este lugar era muy seguro.
englishTranslation: In the past, this place was very safe.
vocabIncluded: seguro: adjective meaning "safe" or "secure" when used with Ser

spanishExample: En ese entonces era el momento de hacerlo.
englishTranslation: Back then was the moment to do it.

spanishExample: Es el momento de hacerlo este mes.
englishTranslation: It’s the moment to do it this month.

spanishExample: Está claro que es tiempo de irse.
englishTranslation: It’s clear that it is time to leave.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
claro: adjective meaning "clear" when used with Estar
irse: any use of Ir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to "leave"

spanishExample: Ha querido hacerlo él mismo.
englishTranslation: He has wanted to do it himself.
vocabIncluded: ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
mismo: adjective meaning "herself", "myself", etc. for emphasis (e.g. "yo misma")

spanishExample: Podemos hacerlo todo a la vez por la mañana.
englishTranslation: We can do it all at once in the morning.

spanishExample: Queremos estar seguros, tiempo al tiempo.
englishTranslation: We want to be safe, give it time.
vocabIncluded: seguro: adjective meaning "sure" when used with Estar

spanishExample: Quiere hacer una fiesta.
englishTranslation: He wants to throw a party.

spanishExample: Quieren lo que tú quieres y lo que ella siempre ha querido.
englishTranslation: They want what you want and what she has always wanted.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Quieres hacer esto de vez en cuando.
englishTranslation: You want to do this once in a while.
vocabIncluded: de vez en cuando: "once in a while" (idiom)

spanishExample: Quieres ir esta semana, pero ellos quieren ir esta noche.
englishTranslation: You want to go this week, but they want to go tonight.

spanishExample: Quiero estar en ese lugar por un mes.
englishTranslation: I want to be in that place for one month.

spanishExample: Quiero estar segura, pero a veces no lo estoy.
englishTranslation: I want to be sure(f), but sometimes I’m not.
vocabIncluded: lo: "that way", "like that", constructed like a direct object (esp with Ser and Estar)
seguro: adjective meaning "sure" when used with Estar

spanishExample: Una vez que vayamos, podemos hacerlo de una vez por todas.
englishTranslation: Once we go, we can do it once and for all.
vocabIncluded: de una vez por todas: "once and for all" (idiom)
una vez que: idiom meaning "once", right before another phrase

spanishExample: Vas a querer dos minutos para no estar solo.
englishTranslation: You’re going to want 2 minutes in order not to be alone(m).
vocabIncluded: para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Ya mismo queremos estar felices.
englishTranslation: This instant we want to be happy.
